subject: MPHY
name: Intro Medical Physics
info: Interactions and energy deposition by ionizing radiation in matter; medical imaging; radiation therapy physics and related radiation safety topics.

subject: MPHY
name: Medical Physics Seminar I
info: This seminar introduces new medical physics graduate students to the program, graduation requirements, and research conducted by medical physics faculty.

subject: MPHY
name: Medical Physics Seminar II
info: This seminar introduces new medical physics graduate students to the program, graduation requirements, practice of medical physics, and research conducted by medical physics faculty and students.

subject: MPHY
name: Radiation Physics & Dosimetry
info: Interactions and energy deposition by ionizing radiation in matter; concepts, quantities and units in radiological physics; principles and methods of radiation dosimetry.

subject: MPHY
name: Radiation Therapy Physics I
info: Theoretical/experimental aspects of radiological physics. Physicalproperties of various ionizing radiations, interactions of ionizingradiations with matter, methods of radiation dose measurement.prereq: instr consent

subject: MPHY
name: Med/Health Physics of Imag I
fullname: Medical and Health Physics of Imaging I
info: Physics of diagnostic imaging: specification/quantification of image quality, X-ray production, image receptors, magnetic resonance imaging, radiation exposure and protection. Special imaging techniques, including mammography, computed tomography, and direct digital image capture.prereq: 5170 or instr consent

subject: MPHY
name: Radiation Biology
info:
Effects of ionizing radiation on cells, tissues, and organisms. Biochemical/physiological bases of radiation effects. Biological rationale for radiation therapy practices.

prereq: 5170 or instr consent

subject: MPHY
name: Radiation Therapy Physics II
info: Measurements of radiation quality, output, and depth dose distributions for clinical use. Treatment parameter calculation. Beam modification and shaping. Treatment planning for fixed field and rotational therapy inexternal beam, intracavitary, and interstitial therapy. Computer applications in treatment planning. Principles/criteria for radiation protection.prereq: 5170 or instr consent

subject: MPHY
name: Med/Health Physics of Imag II
fullname: Medical and Health Physics of Imaging II
info: Physics of diagnostic imaging. Ultrasound, theoretical/experimental applications of radionuclides in medicine and biology. Counting statistics and imaging systems associated with radiopharmaceuticals, radiation dosimetry, and safety in nuclear medicine.prereq: 5170 or instr consent

subject: MPHY
name: Radiation Therapy Physics Lab
info: This course provides students hands-on experience with hardware/software used in radiation therapy clinic for physics measurements.

subject: MPHY
name: Physical Principles of MRI
fullname: Physical Principles of Magnetic Resonance Imaging
info: Magnetic resonance imaging physics, spatial selection and encoding, imaging hardware, and system engineering. Imaging sequences, signal-to-noise, and contrast.

subject: MPHY
name: Advanced Physics of MRI
fullname: Advanced Physics of Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)
info: NMR (nuclear magnetic resonance) and MRI physics, spatial selection and encoding, imaging hardware and system engineering. Imaging sequences, associated contrast/resolution. Recent developments in MRI.prereq: 5174 or instr consent

subject: MPHY
name: Med Img Sci
info: Role of digital image science in medical imaging. Measurement of image quality, digital radiography. Image reconstruction for CT, SPECT, PET, and MRI. 3D image processing, image registration/visualization. Picture archiving, communications systems.prereq: 5171 or instr consent

subject: MPHY
name: Adv Topics in Rad Therapy Phys
fullname: Advanced Topics in Radiation Therapy Physics
info: Special procedures. Total body irradiation, intensity-modulated radiation therapy, stereotactic radiosurgery/radiotherapy, image-guided radiation therapy. Treatment planning algorithms/techniques. Brachytherapy.prereq: [5170, 5173] or instr consent

subject: MPHY
name: Directed Study
info: Individualized study under faculty direction.prereq: instr consent

subject: MPHY
name: Directed Research
info: Individualized research under faculty direction.prereq: instr consent

subject: MPHY
name: FTE: Master's
info: (No description)prereq: Master's student, adviser and DGS consent

subject: MPHY
name: FTE: Doctoral
info: (No description)prereq: Doctoral student, adviser and DGS consent

subject: MPHY
name: Doct Pre-Thesis Cr*
info: tbdprereq: Doctoral student who has not passed prelim oral; no required consent for 1st/2nd registrations, up to 12 combined cr; dept consent for 3rd/4th registrations, up to 24 combined cr; doctoral student admitted before summer 2007 may register up to four times, up to 60 combined cr

subject: MPHY
name: Thesis Credit:Mast*
info: (No description)prereq: Max 18 cr per semester or summer; 10 cr total required [Plan A only]

subject: MPHY
name: Thesis Credit:Doct*
info: (No description)prereq: Max 18 cr per semester or summer; 24 cr required
